ovdesc.p: This module has two functions. Firstly, to record the charge group for T24 applications and secondly, recording the details regarding the periodic charges to be levied against the customer.

A record for each customer will be automatically created whenever a new "customer" record is authorised. Default values for the application charge groups will be inserted. This is cone via the use of the CONDITION PRIORITY file.
The following fields are used for recording the application group numbers other than securities:-
XX.NN APPLICATION XX.NN DEFAULT.GROUP CC.NN ACTUAL.GROUP
The following fields are used for recording group number for the securities charge applications:-
XX.NN SC.APPLICATION XX.NN.NN PORTFOLIO XX.NN.NN SC.DEF.GROUP XX.NN.NN SC.ACT.GROUP XX DEPOSITORY.GROUP

These two multi-valued groups will be expanded for each of the applications installed. If an application is not present on the Company record then no data will be defaulted for that application. The field DEFAULT.GROUP and ACTUAL.GROUP will initially be defaulted and both will be the same.
The ACTUAL.GROUP may then be updated by the user if he wishes to override the system default value.

In the case of Securities when the customer charge record is first created the "PORTFOLIO" field will be set to "ALL" as at this stage no portfolios have been created. This sub-value will then be the default for all portfolios for that customer. The user may specify special conditions by creating a new sub-value set and entering the portfolio number and its associated group.
The last field in the securities group is the customer group number to be used when a customer is a depository and defines the group for calculating safekeeping charges for the Depository.
A further set of fields will record the periodic charge data. These will not be defaulted when the record is created but will need to be entered by the user. These fields are:-
XX.NN CHARGE.FREQ XX.NN DEBIT.ACCOUNT XX.NN.NN CHARG.CODE

A charging frequency date will be entered with an account number to debit. These fields are multi-valued to allow for multiple charging periods. Within each frequency a sub-valued list of charges may be taken by entering the relevant charge codes.
A separate account used for all commissions and charges payable can be specified. This amount will be used, if specified, in the Funds Transfer application only.

desc.p: Defines the account number to be debited when the customer is required to pay commission/charges.
This account will be used in the Funds Transfer application only, when the customer is required to pay commission/charges.
An override will be required if the account customer is not the same as the customer of the record.
1 to 14 numeric account number 3 - 10 alphanumeric account mnemonic (Optional Input)
Must exist on the Account file.
Cannot be an internal amount.
Defines the key to the Customer charge record.
The customer number entered is validated against the customer file and enriched with the customer short name.
Creation of new records is not allowed.
In addition to the customer number , company code may can be appended with a hypen.
Input is mandatory.
Company code appended with hypen is optional.

t.p: Defines the suffix for a portfolio.
When a record is created the value in this field is "ALL".
For a Customer, if there are multiple Portfolios and each one of them falls under different FX.GEN.CONDITION IDs, details of the same can be seen updated in CUSTOMER.CHARGE table.

If a customer level record in XX.GROUP.CONDITION files is authorized (For FT, FD and LC), it's ID (C-CUSTOMER.NUMBER) automatically gets defaulted here. In that case, its value could not be changed. When the customer level record in XX.GROUP.CONDITION files (For FT, FD and LC) is reversed then value of DEFAULT.GROUP field is automatically defaulted here. For the FT, FD and LC applications, the processing checks for the customer level record in XX.GROUP.CONDITION first.
